title: Ethereum holders back in profit as ETH price gears up for $4K breakout
summary: Ethereum investors are back in profit, raising the chance for a rally to $4,000, but resistance at $3,800 could delay recovery.

title: Bitcoin ETF demand stalls as US shutdown optimism fails to lift sentiment
summary: Bitcoin ETF inflows and Strategy’s BTC acquisitions have been the main vehicles fueling Bitcoin’s momentum this year, according to market analysts.

title: Why Tether is acting more like a central bank than a stablecoin
summary: Once a simple stablecoin issuer, Tether now mirrors central bank mechanics with reserves, profits and policy-like decisions.

title: Bitcoin sees key $107K rejection: Watch these BTC price support levels next
summary: Bitcoin failed to find support at $107,000 as its rebound stopped short of a bull market comeback; analysis warned of new “OG selling pressure” to come.

title: NFT and memecoin markets recover after month-long crypto slump
summary: NFTs posted selective gains led by blue chips, while memecoins rallied broadly across major names in a sentiment-driven rebound.

title: CleanSpark plans $1.15B raise to expand Bitcoin mining, AI infrastructure
summary: CleanSpark is among the leading Bitcoin mining companies expanding into AI data center infrastructure, seeking diversified sources of revenue amid post-Bitcoin halving pressure.

title: Bitcoin signals bullish reversal as ‘apparent demand’ hits four-month highs
summary: Bitcoin’s apparent demand and spot activity are picking up; momentum will be re-ignited once BTC breaks through $110,000.

title: Brazil classifies stablecoin payments as foreign exchange under new rules
summary: Banco Central do Brasil’s new framework brings crypto companies under banking-style oversight, extending AML and FX rules to stablecoins.

title: 61% of institutions plan to boost crypto exposure despite October crash: Sygnum
summary: Despite October’s crash, the end of the US government shutdown could bring “bulk approvals” for altcoin ETFs, catalyzing the next wave of institutional inflows, according to Sygnum.

title: Willy Woo floats ‘dummies guide’ to evading the quantum Bitcoin threat
summary: Some critics argue the threat posed by quantum computers is overblown, including Strategy chairman Michael Saylor, who has once called it a marketing ploy to pump quantum-branded tokens.
